subject: english
note: English (Non-Medium) - English is taught as a subject, not as the medium of instruction in P1
overview: In P1, English is taught as a subject through themes. Children develop listening, speaking, pre-reading, and pre-writing competences. English skills acquired here will form the basis for using English as the medium of instruction from P5 onwards.
learning_outcomes: Develop listening skills and comprehension of simple English speech
Speak English using simple structures and vocabulary from themes
Recognize and identify letters and basic sight words
Develop pre-writing skills and letter formation
Build vocabulary related to thematic contexts
Participate in simple English songs, rhymes, and role-plays
Develop confidence in using English in familiar contexts
overall_competences: Listening and understanding simple English instructions
Speaking in short phrases and sentences
Naming objects and activities in English
Singing English songs and reciting rhymes

themes.name: Our School
listening_speaking: Naming school activities (sweep, garden, read, write, play, pray, clean, learn)
Asking and answering: 'What is she/he doing?'
Role-playing calls and commands (go, come, take, stop)
Saying tongue twisters related to school
vocabulary: School activities: sweep, garden, read, write, play, pray, clean, learn, teach
School objects: gate, flag, desk, chair, ball, book

themes.name: Our Home
listening_speaking: Naming family members (mother, father, sister, brother, baby)
Naming household items (bed, table, chair, door, window)
Responding to questions: 'What is your name?' 'How old are you?'
Describing family members using adjectives (big, small, tall, short)
pre_writing: Pasting picture sequences of daily routines
vocabulary: Family members: mother, father, sister, brother, baby, grandmother, grandfather
Home items: bed, table, chair, door, window, kitchen, room

themes.name: Our Community
listening_speaking: Identifying community helpers (teacher, doctor, nurse, policeman, shopkeeper)
Naming community places (school, clinic, shop, church, mosque)
Using positional language (near, far, beside, behind)
pre_reading: Recognizing sight words for community helpers
Following simple picture stories about the community
vocabulary: Community helpers: teacher, doctor, nurse, policeman, shopkeeper, farmer
Community places: school, clinic, shop, church, mosque, market, post office

themes.name: The Human Body and Health
listening_speaking: Naming body parts (head, eyes, ears, nose, mouth, arms, legs, hands, feet)
Naming personal hygiene items (soap, water, toothbrush, towel)
Describing actions (wash, brush, eat, drink, sleep, exercise)
pre_reading: Matching body part labels to diagrams
Recognizing sight words for body parts
vocabulary: Body parts: head, eyes, ears, nose, mouth, arms, legs, hands, feet, fingers, toes
Health actions: wash, brush, eat, drink, sleep, exercise, rest

themes.name: Weather
listening_speaking: Naming weather conditions (sunny, rainy, cloudy, windy, hot, cold)
Asking about weather: 'What is the weather like?'
vocabulary: Weather: sunny, rainy, cloudy, windy, hot, cold, wet, dry
Clothing: coat, umbrella, sandals, raincoat, hat, shoes

themes.name: Accidents and Safety
vocabulary: Safety: safe, unsafe, danger, hazard, careful, help, fire, water, poison, sharp
Safety actions: wash hands, hold hands, look, listen, stop, go

themes.name: Living Together
listening_speaking: Expressing emotions and feelings (happy, sad, angry, afraid)
Using polite language (please, thank you, sorry)
Asking and answering questions about relationships
Singing songs about friendship and cooperation
vocabulary: Emotions: happy, sad, angry, afraid, shy, excited, tired
Social words: friend, family, share, help, sorry, please, thank you, sorry, kind

themes.name: Food And Nutrition
listening_speaking: Naming food items and food groups
vocabulary: Foods: rice, beans, vegetables, fruits, mango, banana, orange, tomato, spinach, meat, fish
Food groups: grains, proteins, vegetables, fruits, milk
Eating items: plate, cup, spoon, fork, knife, glass

themes.name: Our Transport
listening_speaking: Naming types of transport (car, bus, bicycle, motorcycle, boat, plane)
vocabulary: Transport: car, bus, bicycle, motorcycle, boat, plane, truck, train, taxi
Transport parts: wheel, door, window, seat, steering wheel, engine

themes.name: Things We Make
listening_speaking: Naming craft materials (paper, clay, beads, wood, leaves)
vocabulary: Materials: paper, clay, wood, beads, leaves, stones, sticks, string, rope
Making verbs: make, build, create, paint, draw, paste, fold, cut, tear

themes.name: Our Environment
pre_reading: Matching plants and animals to their names
vocabulary: Plants: tree, flower, grass, leaf, root, stem, seed
Animals: bird, butterfly, insect, dog, cat, cow, goat, snake

themes.name: Peace And Security
vocabulary: Peace words: peace, kind, share, help, cooperate, respect, listen, calm
Security: safe, security, guard, protect, careful, warning

teaching_methodology: Thematic integration: English taught through theme-related contexts
Listening to teacher models and recordings
Repetition and choral work (songs, rhymes, poems)
Role-play and dramatization for speaking practice
Pair and group work for speaking practice
assessment_focus: Listen for understanding of simple English instructions
Observe speaking: Can child use simple structures and vocabulary?
Check letter recognition and pre-writing skills through drawings
Record listening and speaking competences through observation
Use drawings and role-play as evidence of comprehension
Informal, continuous assessment in natural contexts
note_on_english_medium: In P1, English is NOT the medium of instruction. Children are taught IN their local/familiar language. English is taught as a subject to build skills for P4-P7 when English becomes the medium of instruction.
resources: English story books (with pictures and simple text)
Audio recordings of songs and stories
Wall charts with thematic vocabulary and structures
Alphabet cards and letter formation guides
